title.narrative: NAT CAPACITY BUILDING FOR PUBLIC POL

description.narrative: By September 2015, representatives of public sector and civil society, have increased their capacities to produce, circulate and apply evidence-based knowledge in the formulation, management and monitoring of policies, budgets and laws to guarantee childrenÂ´s and adolescentsÂ´ rights, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By September 2015, children and adolescents constitute an evidence-based priority in national legislation and in socioeconomic policies, at national and sub-national levels.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs policy planning and administration
Other General Services support to civil society
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By September 2015, representatives of public sector and civil society, have increased their capacities to produce, circulate and apply evidence-based knowledge in the formulation, management and monitoring of policies, budgets and laws to guarantee children´s and adolescents´ rights

Number of draft legislation identified by the Facts and Rights Strategy, whose content has been modified based on the advocacy strategy, to include the principles of the international and national legal framework on guaranteeing and / or restoring children and adolescents rights.

Number of created or strengthened partnerships and / or instances of coordination between public, private, community, academic or cooperation sectors to develop the formulation, management and monitoring processes of the public policy for children and adolescents

National analysis of the security situation and restoration of children and adolescents rights, with a focus on equity, carried out jointly with government agencies, control bodies and the civil society, as input for decision making in the formulation, execution and monitoring processes of public policies for children and adolescents. (Yes / No)

Strategy designed (Yes / No) to influence the draft laws selected by Facts and Rights, so that they include the principles of the international and national regulatory framework on ensuring the rights of children and adolescents.

Number of processes and / or preventive monitoring tools and management controls that have been strengthened through joint action between UNICEF and the Controlling Bodies to ensure and restore the rights of children and adolescents.
